title: Western Digital launches My Cloud OS 3 for its range of cloud storage hard drives
text: #My Cloud API Western Digital launches My Cloud OS 3 for its range of cloud storage hard drives Western Digitalâ€™s new My Cloud OS 3 will be compatible with My Cloud, My Cloud Mirror and My Cloud Expert Series EX2/EX4 storage devices in India. Chethan Rao | 18 September 2015, 6:55 PM IST Share Western Digital has just announced its new My Cloud OS 3, which will soon be available as a free download on supported hard drives.The company has announced that the update will be supported by the current crop of My Cloud, My Cloud Mirror and My Cloud Expert Series EX2/EX4 devices that are available in the market.Keeping the developers in mind Western Digital has also released My Cloud Device SDK and My Cloud API so that they can bundle in new features overtime.As for the My Cloud OS 3, users shouldn't expect a drastic change in functionality as the company hasn't made a mention of that officially. However, you can be assured that there will be some decent under the hood features that would enhance security on these cloud based storage solutions and ensure that your personal data is safe.The files can also be accessed using dedicated mobile apps on Android and iOS, known as WD My Cloud. If you're a photography enthusiast, you can also allow files to be uploaded to the cloud directly from your gallery or camera roll, which can then be accessed anytime.The company has also launched its proprietary My Cloud Mirror Gen 2 storage devices with prices starting from Rs 23,500 for the 4TB model and extending up to Rs 55,000 for the 12TB version. However, these won't arrive in the Indian markets until November at least, so you will have some waiting to do before getting your hands on it."Availability of better infrastructure such as 4G and increased broadband speeds has made it compelling for our consumers to adopt personal cloud. They enjoy the peace of mind from backing up PCs, smart phones, and tablets to and centralizing personal content on their My Cloud systems," said Khalid Wani, Director, Content Solutions Business, India, Middle East and Africa, WD. "They tell us they are confident in the privacy, control and anywhere access we provide them with the My Cloud OS. Now, with My Cloud OS 3, we've made users' management of their digital lives easier than ever before."
